item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, January 25, 2025 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. The FizzBuzz that did not get me the job (60 points | 15 comments)
2. First Look: Loops, by Pixelfed – Decentralised TikTok Competitor (2024) (41 points | 11 comments)
3. Life lessons from the first half-century of my career (167 points | 33 comments)
4. Show HN: Cs16.css – CSS library based on Counter Strike 1.6 UI (634 points | 111 comments)
5. File Explorer is merged to Helix editor (127 points | 13 comments)
6. Show HN: Trolling SMS spammers with Ollama (203 points | 67 comments)
7. TinyZero (70 points | 14 comments)
8. Wild – A fast linker for Linux (317 points | 151 comments)
9. Show HN: Lightpanda, an open-source headless browser in Zig (200 points | 105 comments)
10. A phishing attack involving g.co, Google's URL shortener (290 points | 126 comments)
11. Gongzilla: The collapsing cost of dumb ideas (3 points | discuss)
12. Snowdrop OS – a homebrew operating system from scratch, in assembly language (247 points | 50 comments)
13. The hidden complexity of scaling WebSockets (124 points | 36 comments)
14. Subpixel Snake [video] (235 points | 46 comments)
15. Show HN: Using YOLO to Detect Office Chairs in 40M Hotel Photos (133 points | 62 comments)
16. You could have invented Fenwick trees (99 points | 19 comments)
17. Her dad, the 10k records he left behind and a viral lesson in grief (104 points | 48 comments)
18. Show HN: Onit – open-source ChatGPT Desktop with local mode, Claude, Gemini (115 points | 35 comments)
19. New book-sorting algorithm almost reaches perfection (206 points | 46 comments)
20. Ask HN: Why buy domains and 301 redirect them to me? (303 points | 98 comments)
21. Chatbox: Cross-platform desktop client for ChatGPT, Claude and other LLMs (60 points | 13 comments)
22. Caltrain's electric fleet more efficient than expected (273 points | 195 comments)
23. How I Use Home Assistant in 2025 (208 points | 232 comments)
24. Anatomy of a Formal Proof (107 points | 5 comments)
25. A very Chicago gamble (140 points | 73 comments)
26. A WebAssembly compiler that fits in a tweet (214 points | 25 comments)
27. Cloud Virtualization: Red Hat, AWS Firecracker, and Ubicloud internals (72 points | 11 comments)
28. Every System is a Log: Avoiding coordination in distributed applications (177 points | 130 comments)
29. Urban legend: I think there is a world market for maybe five computers (110 points | 66 comments)
30. Trying out Zed after more than a decade of Vim/Neovim (164 points | 116 comments)
